The detection rule only identifies the initial execution of Remote Desktop Protocol via process creation, lacking persistence, lateral movement, and data collection detection. It relies on a single event, mstsc.exe image selection, without correlating across multiple stages. This limits its ability to understand the full attack sequence.

strengths: Utilizes Sysmon for process creation monitoring
weaknesses: Does not account for persistence or lateral movement

results.summary: Rule for attack.lateral_movement (Remote Desktop Protocol Detection) scored 0.56/1.0 (Poor). Best performance in realism (0.76). Needs improvement in detectability (0.40). Issues found in: detection_specificity, detection_sensitivity, attack_coverage
